medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent abdominal pain primarily located in the left upper quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began approximately 24 hours prior to presentation, becoming increasingly severe, exacerbated by straining and associated with nausea. The pain is non-radiating and sharp in quality, associated with oral intake. There is also a history of recent constipation, alleviated with dulcolax.
medical_history.past_medical_history: CAD s/p clean cath, GERD, hiatal Hernia, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, depression (with history of hospitalization and suicidality), s/p R elbow debridement for medial epicondylitis (with residual numbness in unspecified digits).
medical_history.family_history: Mother with history of depression and schizoaffective disorder, multiple past hospitalizations including shock treatment. Mother had myocardial infarction and died at unspecified age. Father had myocardial infarction and cardiac death at unspecified age. Maternal grandparents both had heart disease. Has older brother who is healthy and half-sister with depression.
